page.title: 01THE BRAES OF GLENLIVET
page.content: Just called the Braes, this secluded glen below the Ladder hills is mostly grouse moor with some farming which is not helped by bogs, deer and bad weather. There are few amenities as the post office, shop and school are all closed, but at the road-end a distillery and Catholic Church serve the spiritual needs of the people! Tracks leave the road to the farms and the old College of the Scalan. Conifer plantations form wind breaks. Clumps of native trees often found near ruined walls, show that there had been many more people living here at one time. Some of the old croft houses are now holiday homes. The age groups are mixed and a bus load of children leave for school each day. A small public hall is in frequent use for various social occasions.
